Description:
Inner City Oasis
With warm filtered sunlight through every window, enjoying one of Clifton Hill's most highly sought-after parkland positions with this exceptional renovated 1st-floor apartment boasting enormous lifestyle appeal. Tranquil Merri Creek parks and trails at your doorstep, cafes, Queens Parade and Clifton Hill Train Station just a short stroll away. Located in the coveted 'Clifton View Apartments', first home buyers and investors will be thrilled with the wonderful inner-city lifestyle opportunity. Offers 1 double bedroom with built-in robes, large living room, bright kitchen/dining, gleaming bathroom with laundry taps, separate toilet, high ceilings, polished timber floors, heating, secure intercom entry and lock up garage with storage. Not to be missed
Photo ID Required at All Inspections
Insights: 14/14 The Esplanade, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2017 and 12 other 1 bedroom unit in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Rare North-Rear Potential Near Parkland
The long wait is over and the deep north-facing rear block, extra width and prized parkland position that highlight this rare opportunity are finally yours - so get started on your idyllic inner-city showpiece! Opening to a spacious sun-drenched backyard with direct drive-in ROW, this Victorian with three big bedrooms has the ideal footprint, large proportions and the enormous potential you've been looking for to add substance, style and value with the definitive renovation (STCA). Enviably located in the Village for a fabulous family lifestyle just footsteps to Quarries Park, cafes, school and train station; this enticing home includes sizable living room, kitchen and meals area, bathroom, laundry, period features, garden shed and roller-door off-street parking. (Land 290 sqm approximately)
Andrew Simondson : 0412 999 128
Insights: 72 Ramsden Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2017 and 25 other 3 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Vintage style with a contemporary twist
Tucked away in an exclusive city-edge neighbourhood, this vibrant Victorian is guaranteed to impress with its classic charm, designer extension and long list of features. Beyond its lush front garden and timeless facade, the home's vogue interior showcases 2 large bedrooms (main with built-in robes), stylish central bathroom and separate powder room, plus a spacious open lounge/dining area leading out to a private sun-drenched courtyard garden complete with fish pond water feature. Add to this a marble-bench kitchen with stainless steel appliances, polished concrete and hardwood floors, towering ceilings, in-slab heating, attic storage and more. An aspirational location with village cafes, Clifton Hill Station and Queens Parade trams, Yarra River and Darling Gardens all within walking distance.
Insights: 15 Dally Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2017 and 16 other 2 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
CLIFTON HILL'S FINEST... LARGE LAND... UNLIMITED POTENTIAL...
Immediately liveable throughout whilst offering endless scope to renovate, re-develop or create the dream home on a beautiful tree lined street.
- 3/4 large bedrooms
- Central bathroom
- Dining room adjoining multi facet room
- Open plan kitchen off living
- High ceilings, period details
- Land 9m x 38m approx. 342sqm approx.
- Double garage via Hodgkinson Street
- Separate workshop, laundry and outhouse
- Huge rear yard - possible multi-unit or re-development site (STCA)
Popular corner block position, across from the Collingwood leisure centre and Darling Gardens. Easy access to cafes, shops and public transport, minutes from the city, this is your chance to enjoy low maintenance metropolitan living.
Conditions of entry - IDENTIFICATION and contact number required, otherwise entry may be refused.
Insights: 7 Turnbull Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2017 and 10 other 4 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Love the Space, Love the Lifestyle…
Part of a 2 lot subdivision and without the confines of an owners corporation this double storey town residence is the epitome for low maintenance living and a viable alternative to buying a terrace. Built circa 2000 and enjoying a highly desirable location with ease of access to Darling Gardens, any number of enticing cafes/eateries, highly regarded schooling and a myriad of public transport options this sizeable home offers superb living.
Featuring 2 upstairs bedrooms with robes (Huge master bedroom!), beautifully appointed bathroom, open plan living/dining with double door access to a paved courtyard favoured with a northern orientation, generously proportioned kitchen with gas cooking & dishwasher, full size laundry, powder room and single lock up garage. Add to this being on a cul-de-sac with no through traffic, well-appointed fittings throughout including heating & cooling and all you need to do is move in… Outstanding!
Insights: 3 Anderson Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2017 and 16 other 2 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Location, luxury and impressive dimensions - 83sqm approx.
In a boutique block (1 of only 4), this as-new first-floor apartment delivers an exceptional city-edge lifestyle/investment opportunity with its oversized floorplan and first-class features throughout. Light-filled interior boasts one double bedroom (with BIRs and private balcony), luxurious central bathroom, vast open-plan living and dining area with double sliding doors revealing a north-facing entertainers' terrace. Add to this a marble-bench kitchen with integrated Asko dishwasher and Bosch cooking appliances (including induction cooktop), heating and cooling, hardwood floors, Euro laundry, plus alarm system, storage cage and secure entry foyer. A dream location, walking distance to village cafes, Clifton Hill Station and Queens Parade trams, Mayors Park and Darling Gardens.
Insights: 101/51 Ramsden Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2017 and 12 other 1 bedroom unit in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Contemporary refinement, parkside privacy
This light-filled residence in an acclaimed garden development offers privacy, security and space in an exclusive precinct metres from Yarra parkland and close to schools, freeway access, Clifton Hill Station and cafes. Perfect for small families and downsizers, this stylish home with courtyard entry comprises two double bedrooms (custom BIRs, ensuite with walk-in shower to main), designer kitchen with stone benchtops open to a generously proportioned living/dining room and north-facing terrace, family bathroom, concealed laundry and internal-entry garage. Features include polished hardwood floors, split-system air conditioning, storage and premium appointments.
Insights: 23 Reillys Way, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2017 and 16 other 2 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Boundless Possibilities
In the heart of Clifton Hill village, walking distance from parklands and cafes and seconds from the Clifton Hill Station is this fantastic period home. Set on a wide block (over 7m), detached on one side with rear access making it the perfect home with boundless potential for future renovation and extension. Featuring generous double bedrooms off a wide hall, ornate fireplaces, beautiful timber floors, open plan kitchen/meals area looking out onto a large courtyard with access for a car, separate laundry and bathroom. Located in sought-after primary school catchments. Stunning proportions and a premier location make this terrace one too good to pass.
Insights: 42 Grant Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2017 and 25 other 3 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Spacious Apartment Opposite Parkland
Enjoying one of Clifton Hill's most highly sought-after parkland positions, this 2nd-floor apartment with an exceptional address is brimming with lifestyle bonuses featuring parkland views and garage. Quietly and privately nestled in the coveted 'Clifton View Apartments', this brilliant investment and affordable low-maintenance home presents a wonderful inner-city lifestyle opportunity. With tranquil Merri Creek parks and trails at your doorstep, cafes, Queens Parade and Clifton Hill Train Station, this 1970's apartment offers 2 double bedrooms with built-in robes, large living room, huge kitchen/dining, bathroom, separate toilet, laundry taps, heating and secure intercom entry.
Insights: 15/14 The Esplanade, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2017 and 21 other 2 bedroom unit in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Sophisticated City Edge Location
SOLD by Miles Real Estate. Inner city convenience enjoys a distinctly village vibe in this sophisticated tri level town residence positioned just a short walk from gorgeous Clifton Hill Village, Queens Parade shopping, Darling Gardens and Clifton Hill Station. Enhanced by the peace and privacy of its own street entry, smartly presented proportions rise up to top floor living and entertaining spaces where a granite topped kitchen with stainless steel appliances and a beautifully broad alfresco terrace ensure outstanding indoor/ outdoor entertaining flexibility within a dynamic city edge setting. Two spacious double bedrooms with sizeable built in robes/ storage share a stylish family bathroom with both bath and separate shower, landing study nook and cleverly placed internal light atrium. Includes ducted reverse cycle heating/cooling, secure garage parking with internal access. Only minutes to the CBD, Collingwood Leisure Centre, acres of parkland and Merri Creek walking trails plus a myriad of renowned inner city attractions.
Insights: 55 John Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2017 and 16 other 2 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
An exemplary conversion: architectural excellence
Renovated in timeless style by renowned architect Grant Cheyne, designer of Neil Perry's celebrated Rockpool restaurants, this stunning residence offers vast entertaining spaces, authentic industrial detail and contemporary finishes. Familiar to Offspring fans as the setting for Nina's mum's new romance, this exceptional home is part of the former Pitman Shoe Factory, now superbly planned for 3BR family living and incorporating a spectacular multi-zoned living and dining room with soaring gabled ceiling, opening to a wide roof terrace with CBD views; bespoke kitchen (pantry, concrete benchtops, premium appliances); loft bedroom/retreat with WIR and ensuite; 2 further double bedrooms; sleek bathroom, powder room and concealed laundry. Including 2 car-car garaging and landscaped security entry, this style-setting home close to Dight's Falls, cafes and schools features hydronic heating, air conditioning and ample storage.
Insights: 6/37 Groom Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2017 and 25 other 3 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Immaculate period style with studio
This smartly refurbished 1920s residence with brilliant scope for extension (STCA) offers two double bedrooms opening from a wide fretwork-trimmed hall, spacious living and dining rooms separated by double open fireplaces, well-equipped kitchen with new stainless steel appliances, plus bathroom/laundry. Metres from Yarra parkland and close to schools, Village cafes and station, here is a perfect family home, with a deep landscaped garden for the children to play in, a north-facing entertaining deck, versatile studio and ROW-access storage. Filled with light, this welcoming property features polished timber floors, new carpets and period detail.

Description:
Elevation and Stunning City Views
Situated on Clifton Hill's highest viewpoint this ultra-spacious home boasts elegant and stylish living areas and CBD views. Behind the simple façade of this freestanding Victorian is a spacious 4BR residence, renovated for family living and entertainment in an exclusive neighbourhood close to Village cafes and station, schools and Yarra parkland. Featuring an abundance of natural light, soaring ceilings, internal balcony overlooking main living area and period detail, it comprises an upper level main studio bedroom with balcony and city views, WIR and spa bath ensuite plus 3 further double bedrooms; expansive living/dining room with elevated ceiling and tri-fold doors flowing to an ample courtyard with ROW access, timber decking and established garden, custom kitchen (Franke appliances), elegant bathroom and concealed laundry. Features: Baltic floors, OFP in front bedroom, European style slate paved side light court, reverse-cycle air conditioning, ample storage.
Insights: 31 Clifton Avenue, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2017 and 10 other 4 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Welcome Home
Move straight into this charming semi-detached Victorian home and refurbish or renovate at your leisure. Today's comfortable accommodation includes two bedrooms, living room, central bathroom and open plan kitchen and family / meals area enjoying an outlook the exceptionally deep rear garden. All the classic period features have been retained and include two original fire places, warm polished Baltic pine floors and timber lining boards. You will also love the location - the Yarra Parklands and Dight's Falls are at the end of the street, Clifton Hill Railway Station, busses and trams are close by and put all the amenities of the inner city with-in easy reach.
Belinda Lindsay : 0409 853 769

Description:
Once in a Lifetime...
Set on a huge block of land (approx 586sqm) complete with side and rear ROW, this heritage Edwardian presents a rare and exciting opportunity to renovate and extend (STCA) potentially creating one of the area's biggest and best family homes. First time offered in over 60 years, the home's spacious floorplan includes a wide central hallway with original fretwork, four large bedrooms, bathroom and second WC, formal lounge and dining, kitchen/meals and rear sun room. Features include ducted heating, high ceilings, plus a wonderfully large backyard with extensive brick paving, storage shed/stables and carport via side driveway. Moments from Quarries Park in one of inner-Melbourne's premier neighbourhoods, it's also walking distance to local cafes and Clifton Hill Station, Merri Creek trails and Spensley Street Primary School. Just imagine the possibilities! Nelson Alexander Pty Ltd
Insights: 5 Wright Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2017 and 10 other 4 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Meticulously renovated, private, opposite parkland
In Clifton Hill's most exclusive street, close to acres of Yarra parkland, Village cafes and station, this outstanding ground floor apartment at the rear of a well-maintained garden block is a perfect home or superb investment. Filled with light, with access to a tranquil courtyard and undercover parking, this elegant home offers a spacious living/dining room, separate well-equipped kitchen, two double bedrooms with built-in-robes and a stylish tiled bathroom/laundry with separate WC. Description:
Exceptionally Positioned First Home Or Investment Opportunity
Enjoying its elevated position with the desired northerly-rear aspect, this comfortable two-bedroom home presents an excellent opportunity for first home buyers and astute investors alike to secure a period home in this exceptional inner-city position. In a street lined with iconic Victorian terrace homes, the home is central to some of the inner north's most popular haunts such as Edinburgh and Darling Gardens, Fitzroy Swimming Pool, vibrant Brunswick and Smith Street boutiques, cafes and transport, Queens Parade shopping district, easy Eastern Freeway access and a number of highly regarded schools. The home comprises 2BRs, large formal living room, separate kitchen with gas cooking, neat central bathroom with washing machine taps, separate laundry/storage shed and north-facing courtyard ideal for entertaining with separate access. Features include high ceilings, original OFPs and gas heating.
Conjunctional Agent: Advantage Property Consulting - Tracy Orr
Insights: 2A Council Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2017 and 16 other 2 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Renovate Me, Extend Me, Help Me!
Certainly not for the faint hearted as total renovation is required however note that this dilapidated home possesses outstanding attributes that will ensure at the end of the day your blood, sweat, tears and capital investment will be duly and irrevocably rewarded… This opportunity is rare indeed.
Enjoying a location within one of the most envied suburbs within the inner north with quality eateries, acres of parkland, a multitude of public transport options and well respected schooling all close at hand. In addition a corner allotment of some 212sqm provides ease of access for extension/renovation/vehicle access and sizeable building envelope that offers great scope to extend back and up… This is quality real estate at what will be an affordable price point, just bring your imagination!
PRICE QUOTE & COMPARABLE SALES
In accordance with legislative changes relating to the quoting we stress that the price range offered is our expressed opinion of value and the opinion of value noted on our Auction Authority. Our recommendation will be to set a reserve at the mid-point of this expressed range however the setting of such a reserve will be at the vendor's prerogative.
A sale will not be concluded before auction.
INDICATIVE SALES
66 Noone Street, Clifton Hill SOLD $780,000 June 16
19 Spensley Street, Clifton Hill SOLD $892,000 August 15
122 Noone Street, Clifton Hill SOLD $650,000 November 14
Internal area
212m²

Description:
Where city and country combine
Boasting immediate access to Yarra Bend parklands yet just 5km to the CBD, this immaculate three bedroom residence combines the best of city and country to create a haven for family living. Spacious and bright, the home features a well-ordered kitchen with Bosch appliances flanked by a formal lounge, and generous informal living spilling to a landscaped courtyard for all to enjoy. Two generous bedrooms with BIR's share a modern two-way bathroom, while the expansive master suite, showcasing vaulted ceilings and a retreat, enjoys a private ensuite. Split-system heating/cooling and a single garage with workshop, remote and ROW access complete this home. Enviably positioned to parks, schools, Clifton Hill Station and moments to Queens Parade shopping, cafes and easy Eastern Freeway access.

Description:
Lifestyle Victorian Metres To Parkland
With endless parkland, trails and playground just around the corner, make the Wright choice for an active inner-city lifestyle with this irresistible block-fronted Victorian. Opening to a secluded backyard with alfresco deck, garden and roller door off-street parking, this attractive single-storey home merging period character and modern style filled with an abundance of natural light. Stroll to cafes, village shops, schools and train station and settle straight into this picturesque period home offering arched hallway, two double bedrooms, BIR, dado-panel lounge room, bright open plan living/dining room, kitchen with European appliances, central bathroom, concealed laundry, ducted heating, open fireplaces, high decorative ceilings, polished floorboards and storage shed.
Julie Susnjara : 0408 006 662
Insights: 7 Wright Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2017 and 16 other 2 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
The Cross-Stitch House, an Architectural Oasis
Introducing the Cross-Stitch House. This beautifully renovated Victorian terrace home has been masterfully updated and expanded by Fiona Dunin of FMD Architects and features the high ceilings and decorative features of the original, together with a spectacular rear extension and courtyard garden. Step inside and discover a master bedroom with ample built-in robes, semi-ensuited to perhaps the most beautiful bathroom in Melbourne - boasting gorgeous light from the ferny pocket garden and the most delightful view from the shower. The second bedroom with built-in robes features lovely landscaped garden views to the front.
Walk through and find soaring vaulted ceilings with exposed engineered timber beams and an ultramodern designer kitchen with Miele appliances and integrated fridge. Moving seamlessly through this chic space come to a stunning atrium courtyard complete with pond and paved areas, with architectural elements framing this tranquil oasis for design perfection.
Designed to maximise natural light and with every room having a garden view, this is the perfect stylish downsizer or professional retreat. Just 5 minutes' walk to Clifton Hill station, shops and cafes, and only 20 minutes to the CBD. An ultramodern touch to a classic Victorian, and an opportunity not to be missed. Nelson Alexander Pty Ltd.
Insights: 16 other 2 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.
